data.title: ‘Paths of Glory’ at Billy Wilder Theater among movie screenings in the Los Angeles area
data.meta_description: Los Angeles, San Fernando Valley, Santa Monica areaAmerican Film Institute Fest: Variety of movies, Nov. 6-12. Free tickets from website. Hollywood venues: TCL Chinese Theatre, 6925 Hollywood Blvd.; TCL Chinese 6 Theatres, 6801 Hollywood Blvd.; American Cinematheque at Egyptian Theatre, 6712 Hollywood Blvd. 866-234-3378. www.afi.comInternational Family Film Festival: Family-oriented stories from 17 countries and also […]
data.text:
Los Angeles, San Fernando Valley, Santa Monica area

American Film Institute Fest: Variety of movies, Nov. 6-12. Free tickets from website. Hollywood venues: TCL Chinese Theatre, 6925 Hollywood Blvd.; TCL Chinese 6 Theatres, 6801 Hollywood Blvd.; American Cinematheque at Egyptian Theatre, 6712 Hollywood Blvd. 866-234-3378. www.afi.com

International Family Film Festival: Family-oriented stories from 17 countries and also student movies. Movies begin: 12:30 p.m. Nov. 6; 9:30 a.m. Nov. 7-8. Tickets $10. Raleigh Studios, 5300 Melrose Ave., Hollywood. www.iffilmfest.org

Armenian Film Society at Abril Bookstore: “Dr. Jekyll and Mr. Hyde” (1931), 7:30 p.m. Nov. 6. Discussion on the director Rouben Mamoulian and the movie by Mikael Sharafyan and Arno Yeretzian. Free. 415 E. Broadway, Glendale. 818-243-4112. www.abrilbooks.com

UCLA Film & Television Archive at the Billy Wilder Theater: Jean Grémillon: Le ciel est a vous: “Remorques” (1941) and “L’étrange Monsieur Victor” (1938), 7:30 p.m. Nov. 6. Archive Treasures: “Paths of Glory” (1958), 7:30 p.m. Nov. 7. “We Were There” (1976, documentary) and “Word is Out: Stories of Some of Our Lives” (1977, documentary), 7 p.m. Nov. 8. Tickets $10 online reserved; $9. Hammer Museum, 10899 Wilshire Blvd., Los Angeles. 310-206-8013. www.cinema.ucla.edu

Israel Film Festival: Documentaries, features, shorts and television shows, various days through Nov. 19. Movies begin: 5 p.m. Nov. 7; 12:30 p.m. Nov. 8; 5 p.m. Nov. 9-12. Check website for schedule. Venues: Laemmle Ahrya Fine Arts Theatre, 8556 Wilshire Blvd., Beverly Hills; Laemmle Town Center 5, 17200 Ventura Blvd., Encino.; Laemmle NoHo 7, 5240 Lankershim Blvd., North Hollywood; Laemmle Royal Theater, 11523 Santa Monica Blvd., West Los Angeles. 310-247-1800. www.israelfilmfestival.com

Film at Hillcrest Center for the Arts: “The Kid” (1921), 6:30 p.m. Nov. 8. Musical accompaniment by Rick Friend. Tickets $10. 403 W. Hillcrest Drive, Thousand Oaks. 805-381-1246. www.hillcrestarts.com

Film at Los Angeles County Museum of Art: “This Gun for Hire” (1942), 1 p.m. Nov. 10. Tickets $4. 5905 Wilshire Blvd., Los Angeles. 323-857-6010. www.lacma.org

American Cinematheque at the Aero: “Desperately Seeking Susan” (1985), 7:30 p.m. Nov. 10 ($12; director Susan Seidelman is scheduled to discuss the movie). “Billy Liar” (1963) and “The Night Porter” (1974, Italy), 7:30 p.m. Nov. 11 (actors Tom Courtenay and Charlotte Rampling are scheduled to discuss their movies). Cinema Italian Style 2015: “An Italian Name” (2015) and “The Dinner” (2014), 7:30 p.m. Nov. 13. Most tickets $11; $9 seniors and students. 1328 Montana Ave., Santa Monica. 323-466-3456. www.americancinematheque.com

Movies at North Hollywood Regional Branch Library: Animation series: “The Iron Giant” (1999), 2 p.m. Nov. 12; “The Incredibles” (2004), 2 p.m. Nov. 19. 5211 Tujunga Ave. 818-766-7185. www.lapl.org

Cinematheque at Cal State Northridge: Orson Welles Retrospective: “Chimes at Midnight” (1965), 7 p.m. Nov. 12. Free. Upcoming: “The Immortal Story” (1968) and “Don Quixote” (1955-1985; excerpts from an unfinished movie), Nov. 19. Parking in lots B1-3 ($6). Armer Theater in Manzanita Hall, 18111 Nordhoff St. 818-677-3192. www.csun.edu/mike-curb-arts-media-communication/cinema-television-arts/cinematheque

Film Festival Flix: Monthly film festival experience in North Hollywood: Red carpet photos and a wine and cheese reception, 6 (Michael Roud Photography Studio, 11223 Magnolia Blvd.); “The Preening Swan” (2011), 7:30 p.m. Nov. 12(Laemmle NoHo 7, 5240 Lankershim Blvd.; question and answer session with filmmakers after the movie (The Eclectic, 5156 Lankershim Blvd.). Tickets $15.76. www.filmfestivalflix.com

Central American International Film Festival: Opening night red carpet, 6 p.m. followed by shorts. Shorts and documentaries, 5 p.m. Nov. 14. Features, 5 p.m. Nov. 15. Check website for lectures and movies. Free admission. Screenings at Seely G. Mudd building (SGM), Downey Way and McClintock Avenue on the campus of USC, Los Angeles. centralamericanfilmfest.com

ONGOING:

The Little Mermaid at El Capitan Theatre: Ariel makes an appearance on-stage before and after the screening of the 1989 Disney movie. Show times: 10 a.m.; 1, 4 and 7 p.m. daily through Nov. 22. Tickets begin $15; $12 ages 3-11 on opening night; $13 and $12 on other dates. 6838 Hollywood Blvd., Hollywood. www.elcapitantheatre.com

Holly.Andres@langnews.com

Inland Valley area

UCR ARTSblock: “The Wanted 18” (2015), 7 p.m. Nov. 6; 3 and 7 p.m. Nov. 7. Tickets $9.99; $5 students. 3824 Main St., Riverside. 951-827-4787.artsblock.ucr.edu

Film at Ovitt Family Community Library: “The Princess and The Frog” (2009), 6:30 p.m. Nov. 12. 215 E. C St., Ontario. 909-395-2212. www.ci.ontario.ca.us

Elaine.Lehman@langnews.com

San Gabriel Valley area

El Monte Library: “The Genius of Marian” (2013, made for TV), documentary on Alzheimer’s, 5:30-7:30 p.m. Nov. 5. 3224 Tyler Ave. 626-444-9506. www.colapublib.org

Culture Vulture Monday at Laemmle: From Teatro Real in Madrid “Movimentos: La Danza de la Punta al Tacon” (2014), 7:30 p.m. Nov. 9; 1 p.m. Nov. 10. Tickets $15; $8 seniors. Locations: 450 W. Second St., Claremont; 673 E. Colorado Blvd., Pasadena. 310-478-3836. www.laemmle.com

Foothill Regency Cinema Stadium 10: “The Warriors” (1979), 7:30 p.m. Nov. 10. Tickets $7. 854 E. Alosta Ave., Azusa. 626-334-6007. www.regencymovies.com

Pasadena Central Library: “The Men” (1950), 1 p.m. Nov. 11. 285 E. Walnut St. 626-744-4066. www.pasadenapubliclibrary.net

Norton Simon Museum: “The Umbrellas of Cherbourg” (1964, France), 2 p.m. Nov. 13. Free with museum admission $12; $9 seniors; free for ages 18 and younger. 411 W. Colorado Blvd., Pasadena. 626-844-6941. www.nortonsimon.org/

Linda.Gold@langnews.com

South Bay area

Old Town Music Hall: “The Ghost and Mrs. Muir” (1947), 8:15 Nov. 6; 2:30 and 8:15 p.m. Nov. 7; 2:30 p.m. Nov. 8. Shows begin with a sing-along with music played on a pipe organ and a comedy short. Tickets $10; $8 seniors (cash or check only). 140 Richmond St., El Segundo. 310-322-2592. www.oldtownmusichall.org
